thread.title: The Most and Least Expensive States for Short-Term Vacation Rentals
thread.title_full: The Most and Least Expensive States for Short-Term Vacation Rentals

author: Patrick Allan
title: The Most and Least Expensive States for Short-Term Vacation Rentals
text:
Go to permalink 
If youâ€™re thinking of planning a vacation somewhere in the U.S. for more than a couple nights, renting a place through services like Airbnb can save you some money. These are the states that give you have the best and worst deals on short-term rentals. 
Using data from over 16 million records on residential listings, apartment rentals, and other short-term rentals, Datafiniti was able to build find the median rental price per night for each state. The East coast, it turns out, is the most expensive, with Rhode Island taking the top spot at $165 a night. Delaware, Maine, New Hampshire, and New York are all close behind. The cheapest states for vacation rentals are Oklahoma and Kansas at around $70 a night, with North Dakota, Illinois, and Iowa all within the same price range. You can see the complete data set at the link below, including information on the cheapest and most expensive cities for vacation rentals.
